109961.name: Number of countries that have legalised same-sex marriage
109961.description:
The total number of countries that have legalised same-sex marriage over time. 

Note: The United Kingdom has been included as three separate entities: England/Wales, Northern Ireland, and Scotland, as same-sex marriage was legalised in different years.
109961.datasetName: Same sex marriage law (Pew Research Center, CFR)
109961.s_name: Pew Research Center and the Council on Foreign Relations

source.name: Pew Research Center and the Council on Foreign Relations
source.dataPublishedBy: Pew Research Center and the Council on Foreign Relations
source.additionalInfo: The United Kingdom in the dataset refers to England/Wales. In the United Kingdom, England and Wales were first to legalise same-sex marriage in 2013, Scotland followed in 2014, and Northern Ireland introduced its legalisation in 2019.
